titleStmt.title: A letter from Hampton-Court: of 600 horse and foot risen for the King at Hounslow-Heath, and Hare-warren. The duke of Buckingham with them. And the Lord Francis, the Duke of Richmond, The Lord Peter-borough, and divers lords, gentlemen, and officers of the Kings old souldiers, and their designe to take Lambeth House, and plant ordnance against the Parliament, and to surprize the Committee at Derby-House. And to raise the seige, or relieve Colchester with 2000 horse and foot.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for the generall satisfaction of moderate men,

notesStmt.note: The letter is dated at end: Hampton Court July 5. 1648.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

person.persName: the generall satisfaction of moderate men
